units.title: Integrate transcriptome and chromatin accessibility data using GLUE
units.text: we integrated the two modalities by constructing metacells containing both transcriptome and chromatin accessibility information, defining a total of 24 clusters from 35,499 metacells (Fig. 4a and Supplementary Table 3).
units.rationale: This describes a concrete step in data integration using a specific method (GLUE) to define clusters from multimodal data.

units.title: Infer terminal macrostates and transition probabilities using CellRank
units.text: To follow cell trajectories over time, we used CellRank47 to infer the terminal macrostates (myocytic, epicardial, endothelial and endodermal) and the probability of each cell to transition toward these states based on both pseudotime and RNA velocity information (Fig. 4b and Extended Data Fig. 7a).
units.rationale: This outlines a procedural step using CellRank to infer cell fate trajectories and transition probabilities.

units.title: Generate epicardioids from hiPSC reporter line with FRT-flanked STOP cassette
units.text: To functionally validate the fate potential of different progenitor populations in epicardioids, we generated an hiPSC reporter line in which a flippase (FLP) recognition target (FRT)-flanked neomycin cassette blocking transcription of a pCAG-driven fluorescent reporter (mKate2) fused to a hemagglutinin (HA) tag was knocked into the AAVS1 safe harbor locus49 (Supplementary Results and Supplementary Fig. 4a–f).
units.rationale: This is a precise protocol step for generating a genetically engineered hiPSC reporter line for lineage tracing.

units.title: Transduce epicardioids with lentiviral FLP vector under CDH1 promoter
units.text: For JCF lineage tracing, epicardioids from this reporter line were transduced with a lentiviral vector encoding FLP under the control of the CDH1 promoter at day 15 (Fig. 5a and Extended Data Fig. 9a).
units.rationale: This specifies a timed, actionable procedure for inducing recombination in a specific cell population using a promoter-driven lentiviral vector.

units.title: Perform immunofluorescence analysis for HA tag and lineage markers at day 24
units.text: On day 24, immunofluorescence analysis revealed HA-tag+ SMCs and fibroblasts but also CMs (Fig. 5b, Supplementary Video 3 and Extended Data Fig. 9c), supporting the fate potentiality previously inferred from gene expression (Fig. 1h,i).
units.rationale: This describes a clear experimental endpoint involving staining and imaging to validate lineage outcomes.

units.title: Subcluster epicardial lineage at day 15 and analyze trajectories with CellRank
units.text: We then exploited our metacell dataset to investigate the timing of epicardial fate decisions. For this, we performed subclustering of the epicardial lineage at day 15 (differentially expressed genes (DEGs) listed in Supplementary Table 6) and analyzed cell trajectories using CellRank.
units.rationale: This outlines a methodological procedure for subclustering and trajectory analysis to study fate decisions.

units.title: Apply 4-OHT to induce FLPERT2 expression during JCF stage
units.text: 4-hydroxytamoxifen (4-OHT) was applied at the beginning of the JCF stage (days 7–8; Fig. 4e and Extended Data Fig. 8a).
units.rationale: This is a specific, timed intervention to induce recombination via a chemical inducer in a defined developmental window.

units.title: Apply 4-OHT during FHF stage (days 4–5) as alternative induction
units.text: Alternatively, we applied 4-OHT at the corresponding stage (days 4–5; Extended Data Fig. 8c).
units.rationale: This describes an alternative protocol timing for chemical induction to test developmental timing effects.

units.title: Co-stain for HA tag and ISL1 to confirm JCF labeling
units.text: In the absence of a reliable antibody to MAB21L2, we performed co-staining of the HA tag and ISL1 after 48 h to confirm successful labeling of ISL1+ JCF cells located at the outer layer (Extended Data Fig. 8b).
units.rationale: This is a validation step using immunostaining to confirm successful targeting of a specific cell population.

units.title: Analyze chromatin accessibility patterns along epicardial differentiation
units.text: Assessing chromatin accessibility patterns along epicardial differentiation pathways revealed that regulatory elements associated with fibroblast, mural, and myocytic fates were dynamically accessible in mesothelial epicardial cells.
units.rationale: This describes a protocol step involving analysis of chromatin accessibility to infer regulatory dynamics during differentiation.
